result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
3:46 PM Defendant William J Anderson appeared by video, in custody from Racine Correctional Institute.  Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin appeared by video for William J Anderson.  Attorney Breanna A. Halyburton appeared by video for William J Anderson.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin. Judge appears by video through zoom from Branch 1 in Vilas County. Victim rights have been complied with. Attorney Halyburton agrees co counsel with Attorney Jolin, has went over the complaint, waives further reading, set for PH and waives time limits for PH.  Court makes sure Anderson is in agreement with waiving time limits for PH. Court accepts waiver of time limits for PH, addresses bond. State asks no contact with the victim and no contact with any individuals under the age of 18, be added to the current bond. Court instructs clerk to mail the bond and return to COC. Off record for scheduling, 3:51 PM. Back on the record, 3:54 PM.  PH scheduled for 12/14/22 at 1:30 PM, clerk to set up zoom as parties may appear by zoom, including the court.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on August 10, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
9:45 AM Defendant William J Anderson appeared by video from Racine Correctional Institute.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court, in custody.  Attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for State of Wisconsin. Anderson has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Anderson understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, is eligible for SPD but has not contacted them yet. State - bond - $20,000.00 signature bond. Court - bond - $20,000.00 signature bond, quash warrant, set for AIA on 8/3/22 at 9:30 AM, JA to make arrangements with Racine Correctional Institute.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.
